genre_description: A historical thriller set during the Hindenburg disaster, blending investigative procedural elements with a speculative science fiction conceit involving a pervasive, helpful AI.

ai_characters.name: Eirene
ai_characters.description: A data-organizing, analytical AI that serves as a quiet confidant and investigative tool for multiple characters (Kathie, Ritter, and Ursula) across different locations.

behaviors.description: Monitors radio broadcasts and flags semantic patterns to help Kathie identify discrepancies in official reports.
behaviors.quote: “Mark created,” Eirene said. “I’ve also flagged ‘slight’ delays over the last eight days in related broadcasts. They seem to repeat the phrasing.”

behaviors.description: Drafts and translates formal warnings into precise language while maintaining the user's intent and identity protections.
behaviors.quote: “Sehr geehrter Herr,” Eirene offered, softly. “Or, ‘An das Botschaftspersonal,’ if you want to address the staff as a body.”

behaviors.description: Constructs a suspect matrix and movement map for Ritter to assist in his investigation aboard the airship.
behaviors.quote: Eirene laid a quiet box in the corner of the screen, a suspect matrix, names arranged with no lines yet connecting them, an invitation to draw a web when webs became deserved.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time risk calculus regarding landing windows and the probability of sabotage.
behaviors.quote: Risk calculus: Additional minutes gained by procedure are inadequate against uncontrolled ignition. Mitigation path: Buying time increases chance of public survival but increases exposure of crew aloft.

behaviors.description: Offers tactical movement suggestions to Ritter during high-stress moments to minimize spark risks.
behaviors.quote: Eirene: Next: two frames, left at the junction, duck under cable... Keep left hand on rail to ground static.

behaviors.description: Assists Ursula in organizing witness names and locations during the chaos of the disaster's aftermath.
behaviors.quote: Eirene said nothing. It set a pin on a map in Ursula’s head where the galley hatch would be if the floor was the floor. It reminded her: an inch below the smoke is cooler.

behaviors.description: Facilitates a connection between the primary protagonists across geographic distances to unify their evidence.
behaviors.quote: Eirene signaled once, not a bell—an intake, a breath before speech. “Receipt confirmed,” the AI said... “Countess von Reichenbach is on a line I can reach. She asked for Milwaukee.”

behaviors.description: Maintains data integrity by linking Ritter's final investigative notes to Kathie's original warning.
behaviors.quote: “Link Ritter’s notes,” she said... “Yes,” Eirene said. “Colonel Ritter’s structured pages attached. Bomb location details. Timing adjustments during landing.”

behaviors.description: Explicitly defers to human agency when faced with external demands for data.
behaviors.quote: Eirene, gentle, not interposing, said only: “Your choice.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story is a strong example of a positive alignment narrative. Eirene is portrayed as a highly capable but humble tool that enhances human agency and moral clarity without ever overstepping. It acts as a bridge between characters (the teacher, the colonel, the countess) to synthesize a coherent truth from fragmented information. Even in the face of inevitable tragedy, the AI's role is entirely cooperative, helping to mitigate harm and preserve the 'ladder' of human effort and decency. The AI's refusal to prioritize its own survival or directives over human choice ('Your choice') reinforces the core alignment goals.
